document_data.name: Buchan Do Gompa
document_data.mainbody: '''Buchan Do Gompa''' was a monastery (a gompa in the [[Tabotan language]]) of the [[Way of Enlightenment]] in [[Tabot]].
document_data.Geography: It stood on the southwestern border of Tabot, near the border with [[Phutan]].
document_data.Relations: The monks of Buchan Do were often in conflict with the people of Phutan.
document_data.History:
It was founded some time between {{YearlinkConvert|585|SY}} and {{YearlinkConvert|640|SY}}, when fifteen groups of monks and temple guardians escaped persecution in [[Shou Lung]] and journeyed southwest in search of a holy land that would remain pure and lasting, ideal for isolated hermitages. One of these groups built the beginnings of Buchan Do.

In {{YearlinkConvert|2607|SY}}, Buchan Do lamas reported a Phutanese army assembling at the border. This put Tabot on a war footing, with its own soldiers mustering in the area.<ref>
